content.title: Scheme for Giving Awards to Traditional Artists
content.details: 'Scheme for Giving Awards to Traditional Artists' was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. Through this scheme, awards are conferred to the participant artists whose works are adjudged outstanding among the entries at the State-level Traditional Art Exhibition conducted by the Kuzhu. The awarded works are put on display for public view in the exhibition. The applications are accepted offline in the prescribed form available at the Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu.
benefits: Prize Money of ₹5,000/- per artist is given to 10 artists.
eligibility: The applicant should be an artist.
The artist should be a native of Tamil Nadu by continuous residence for not less than 5 years.
The artist should be in the field of creating artworks like tanjore paintings, glass paintings, traditional paintings, wood carvings, metal sculptures, etc.
content.application_process: Offline. The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu (Tamil Nadu Fine Arts Academy) and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the concerned staff. Fill in all mandatory fields, attach copies of all mandatory documents, and submit the application form either directly or by post to the Member Secretary, Tamil Nadu Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu, Directorate of Art and Culture, Chennai. An entry fee of ₹10/- is required.

faqs.question: Are there any specific requirements regarding the type of art medium or style that applicants must adhere to?
faqs.answer: Yes, artists in traditional fields such as Tanjore Paintings, Glass paintings, Traditional paintings, Wood Carvings, Metal Sculptures, etc., are eligible.

faqs.question: Are there any educational qualifications or degrees required for applicants?
faqs.answer: There are no educational qualifications or degrees required for applicants.

faqs.question: Is there an entry fee for submitting the application form? If so, how much is it?
faqs.answer: Yes, the artist must pay an entry fee of ₹10/- along with the filled-up application form.

faqs.question: To whom should the duly filled and signed application form be submitted?
faqs.answer: The application form should be submitted to the Member Secretary, Tamil Nadu Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu, Directorate of Art and Culture, Chennai.

faqs.question: How can interested applicants obtain the application form for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Interested applicants should visit the office of the Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu during office hours and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the designated staff.

faqs.question: Where are the Traditional Art exhibitions conducted?
faqs.answer: The exhibitions are conducted at the state level by Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu.

faqs.question: What is the prize money awarded to the recipients of the scheme?
What should applicants do if they have any queries regarding the application process?
faqs.answer: Applicants can contact the office of the Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu during office hours for assistance with any queries.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of attaching a bio-data of the artist along with the application form?
faqs.answer: Attaching the bio-data of the artist helps provide additional information about the applicant's background and artistic achievements.

faqs.question: How many artists will receive awards at the State Level Traditional Art Exhibition?
faqs.answer: 10 artists whose works are adjudged as the best by a Jury Committee will receive an award of ₹5,000 each.

faqs.question: Is there an age restriction for participating artists?
faqs.answer: There is no age bar for participation in the Traditional Art Exhibition.
